column5: I'm wondering what's a good location for a fishing day trip from the Burlington area where you can catch a decent sized edible fish?  Seems like most of you guys catching nice fish are doing it up north where there are a lot of decent sized lakes. I usually go fishing in Bronte Creek since it's close to my house, but right now it's mostly just small mouth bass and smaller panfish.  Thanks!
What do u use for bait in Bronte while fishing for the smallies?
Why not look up some of the local conservation areas. They have bass, pike and panfish.
Try Long Point Bay. On Erie, you can get into some nice perch there.
Dunnville if you have a boat, Caledonia or Port Maitland if you don't. Caledonia is fair and steady, Maitland runs hot or cold.
